dict.string:
Lets you get clicks on Layer patches. It works with Render in Image patches, iterators, and the Phone patch. Here are its ports:
Down: Lets you know if the mouse is currently down on the layer. Useful for pressed states. Click: Tells you when the layer is pressed and released. Use this to perform an action once the layer is clicked. Tap: Tells you when the layer is tapped while the mouse is still. Useful for getting clicks on a scrollable layer. Drag: Outputs a 1 if the user started dragging the layer and stays 1 until the mouse is released. Enable: Lets you decide whether the layer should respond to interaction. One example of when you'd want to use this is if you had a shading layer in front of an interactive element. You'd need to disable interaction on the shading layer so you could get clicks on the layer behind it.
